SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.View

Class UserInterface

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.View.UserInterface
All Implemented Interfaces:
View, Runnable
Direct Known Subclasses:
GraphicalUI, TextualUI
public abstract class UserInterface extends Object implements Runnable, View
The UserInterface class is an abstract class responsible for managing the client-side functionality. It provides methods for setting up the RMI and socket clients, adding and notifying listeners, and performing actions such as reconnecting, connecting, and quitting the game. It implements the Runnable interface, allowing it to be run as a thread; and the View interface, allowing it to be used as the base class for view implementations.

    • addListener

      public void addListener(ViewListener listener)

      Specified by:

      Parameters:

    • notifyListeners

      public void notifyListeners(Message m)
      Notifies all the registered ViewListener with the specified Message. The listeners will handle the message accordingly.
      Specified by:
      notifyListeners in interface View
      Parameters:
      m - the Message to notify the ViewListeners with

    • setUpRMIClient

      protected void setUpRMIClient(String ip) throws RemoteException, NotBoundException, InvalidIPAddress
      Sets up the RMI client by connecting to the RMI registry located at the specified IP and port. Throws exceptions if the IP address or port is invalid or if the RMI registry is not bound.
      Parameters:
      ip - the IP address of the RMI registry.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if a remote communication error occurs.
      InvalidIPAddress - if the provided IP address is invalid.
      NotBoundException - if an attempt is made to lookup or unbind in the registry a name that has no associated binding.

    • setUpSocketClient

      protected void setUpSocketClient(String ip) throws RemoteException, InvalidIPAddress
      Sets up the socket client by connecting to the socket server located at the specified IP and port. Throws exceptions if the IP address or port is invalid or if the socket server is not bound.
      Parameters:
      ip - the IP address of the socket server.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if a remote communication error occurs.
      InvalidIPAddress - if the provided IP address is invalid.

    • doReconnect

      protected void doReconnect(String username)
      Sends a ReconnectMessage to the ViewListeners.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the player to reconnect

    • doConnect

      protected void doConnect(String username, int numOfPlayers)
      Sends a RegisterMessage to the ViewListeners to connect to the game.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the player
      numOfPlayers - the number of players in the game

    • doQuit

      protected void doQuit(String username)
      Notifies the ViewListeners that a player has quit the game.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the player who quit
